title: BNP expresses gratitude to PM Modi after his concern over Khaleda Zia's health, offer of ‘all possible support’
summary: BNP expresses gratitude to PM Modi after his concern over Khaleda Zia's health, offer of ‘all possible support’
content: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party has expressed its gratitude towards Prime Minister Narendra Modi after the latter showed concern over the health of the party's leader Khaleda Zia, and said that "India stands ready to extend all possible support" to the former PM. The BNP wrote in a post on X, "BNP expresses its sincere gratitude to the Honourable Prime Minister of India, @narendramodi, for his thoughtful message and kind wishes for the speedy recovery of BNP Chairperson Begum Khaleda Zia." "BNP deeply appreciates this gesture of goodwill and the expression of readiness to extend support," it further added. Modi, in his X post, had said, "Deeply concerned to learn about the health of Begum Khaleda Zia, who has contributed to Bangladesh's public life for many years." "Our sincere prayers and best wishes for her speedy recovery. India stands ready to extend all possible support in whatever way we can," he added. The former Bangladesh prime minister, who has been suffering from a lung infection, was admitted to Dhaka's Evercare Hospital on 23 November. She is currently being treated in the establishment's Coronary Care Unit (CCU) and is under the supervision of both local as well as foreign specialist doctors who are part of a Medical Board formed for her. BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam, after consultations with doctors, had earlier said that her physical condition is very critical. The Chief Adviser of the interim government of Bangladesh, Muhammad Yunus , has also expressed his concerns about Zia's health condition. He had sent another adviser, Asif Nazrul, to the hospital on Friday to inquire about Khaleda Zia's condition. The 80-year-old ex-PM has been suffering from a number of physical ailments, including diabetes, heart disease, kidney complications, as well as liver cirrhosis. In January this year, she had gone to London for advanced treatments. She underwent treatment at a clinic in the British capital for 17 days and later at the house of her son,

title: AT&T customer? Deadline to claim data breach settlement up to $7,500 is close — Check if you're eligible, how to claim
summary: AT&amp;T has agreed to a $177 million settlement for two data breaches in 2024 and earlier. Affected customers are eligible for anywhere between $2,500-7,500 as compensation by December 18. Here's how to claim…
content: United States telecom giant AT&T earlier in September agreed to a $177 million settlement for two data breaches, which means affected customers are eligible for anywhere between $2,500-5,000 as compensation. Notably, as the court have extended the deadline to claim the settlement payment from November 18 to December 18, here's how to check if you are eligible for the sum, and how to apply for it. The company faced multiple lawsuits across the US for “repeatedly” failing to protect consumer data, as per an AP report. AT&T informed millions of customers that their personal data, including Social Security numbers and call records, was compromised in two breaches in 2024. Reports said that the breaches affected over seven million of AT&T customers in 2024, and more than 65 million customers between 2019-2024. While it denies wrongdoing, in a statement to the media the company said it opted to settle to avoid a long legal battle. “We have agreed to this settlement to avoid the expense and uncertainty of protracted litigation. AT&T remains committed to protecting our customers’ data and ensuring their continued trust in us,” it stated. Customers in both data breaches are eligible for claims. The court has awarded two settlement classes, based on different cases, which customers can file for separately. While the combined settlement amount is $177 million for both breaches , a preliminary order in June showed that the first settlement class can claim up to $149 million, while the second settlement class can claim combined $28 million, the AP report added. title: 'Frustrated, desperate': Kangana Ranaut slams Oppn after repeated disruptions on day 1 of Winter Session of Parliament
summary: Actor-politician Kangana Ranaut has slammed the Opposition's repeated disruptions during the first day of Parliament's Winter Session, attributing their behaviour to frustration over electoral losses.&nbsp;
content: Actor-politician Kangana Ranaut has criticised the Opposition, accusing them of deliberate obstruction and growing desperation following consecutive electoral setbacks, as the first day of the Winter Session of Parliament on Monday witnessed repeated disruptions "The more they (the Opposition) lose, the more frustrated they become. The Congress and the rest of the parties have reached a point of desperation," she said, adding that important business scheduled for the day could not be taken up due to disruptions," the BJP MP said, speaking to reporters outside Parliament on Monday. "All the important topics scheduled for today could not be covered. The Parliament could not run. It was adjourned for two hours," she added. Ranaut added that such conduct was damaging the Opposition's credibility in front of the public. "The entire nation is watching, and they (the Opposition) are lowering themselves in the eyes of the people and losing election after election," she said. The first day of the winter session of Parliament saw repeated sloganeering, with the ruling party alleging that the Opposition MPs were not allowing the house to function. Between 11 AM to 2 PM, the house saw three adjournments, and legislative business of just around 50 minutes took place. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman introduced the Manipur Goods and Services Tax (Second Amendment) Bill, 2025, on the floor of the House for consideration and passage. "The Central government amended the Central Goods and Services Act of 2017, particularly section 121 to 134 of the finance Act 2025. This was passed by Parliament and enacted in 2024. These changes also came into effect on October 2025 after more than half of the states updated their GST. But unfortunately Manipur GST could not happen in time as the state assembly was in a suspended mode," the Union Finance Minister said on the floor amid repeated sloganeering. Even after repeated requests, the sloganeering continued, prompting the chair to ad

title: Trump convenes emergency White House meeting as US ramps up pressure on Venezuela
summary: President Donald Trump convened an urgent national security meeting as the US intensifies military pressure on Venezuela, amid strikes on alleged drug vessels and questions over the legality of a follow-up attack.&nbsp;
content: President Donald Trump convened an urgent national security meeting at the White House on Monday evening as his administration intensified its military and diplomatic pressure on Venezuela. Senior defence, intelligence and foreign policy officials gathered in the Oval Office to determine next steps in a rapidly escalating regional confrontation that has sparked legal questions, congressional scrutiny and fears of a widening conflict. The high-level meeting — with attendees arriving shortly before 5 p.m. — brought together key members of Trump’s national security inner circle, including Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth , Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Gen. Dan Caine and Secretary of State Marco Rubio. White House chief of staff Susie Wiles and deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller were also expected. It follows the administration’s recent strikes on suspected Venezuelan drug-trafficking vessels and a rapid build-up of US military assets in the Caribbean as part of “ Operation Southern Spear ”. The Pentagon has now deployed more than a dozen warships and 15,000 troops to the region. White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said earlier in the day that Trump was “meeting with his national security team on this subject and on many matters,” adding: “It’s part of his responsibility to ensure that peace is ongoing throughout the world.” The administration is facing mounting bipartisan concerns about the legality of recent operations targeting alleged drug boats — particularly reports that the US conducted a follow-up strike on survivors after the initial attack. “The law is clear,” Sen. Angus King told CNN . “If the facts are, as have been alleged, that there was a second strike specifically to kill the survivors in the water — that’s a stone-cold war crime. It’s also murder.” On Monday, Leavitt identified the official who authorised the second strike: Adm. Frank M. “Mitch” Bradley, commander of US Special Operations Command. She insisted he acted lawfully. “On

title: Is rapper POORSTACY really dead? Confusion builds as friend says 26-year-old is ‘still fighting’
summary: Rapper POORSTACY reportedly passed away early on Saturday after a sudden medical emergency at a Boca Raton hotel.
content: Hours after American rapper POORSTACY was reported dead due to a medical emergency in Florida, his friend has claimed that the 26-year-old was still alive, and “fighting”. This latest development has caused immense confusion over the rapper's condition. According to a TMZ report, POORSTACY, whose real name is Carlito Junior Milfort, passed away early on Saturday after a sudden medical emergency at a Boca Raton hotel. The report cited police officials to confirm the news of the death of the rapper, who has worked closely with Travis Barker . Authorities have not released details about what led to his apparent death. The police said that the artist had been staying at the hotel for nearly 10 days with a woman and a toddler. No one else was hospitalised. As social media started flooding with RIP messages for the rapper, a friend of POORSTACY, under the Instagram handle ‘@hoodunderratchet’, reposted a story citing the TMZ report, and said he was “still fighting”. “This n*** has not f**king passed yet!!!! I will say RIP when he is gone my brudda stil fighting and when the plug gets pulled I will then say Rip... I love you brudda, (sic)” he wrote. This is the only known social media post to refute the TMZ report about the rapper's death; however, it did not say that the information about POORSTACY's hospitalisation was wrong. A number of fan comments on the rapper's social media profiles seem to suggest that he died by suicide ; however, authorities have not confirmed this claim yet. The Palm Beach County Medical Examiner has, however, said that the cause of death is still under investigation. TMZ spoke to an employee at the Boca Raton hotel, who revealed that the rapper was taken to a local hospital on Saturday morning owing to a medical emergency. He had been living in the establishment for 10 days and had checked in with a woman and a toddler. There was no other report of injury at the hotel on Saturday. title: Pete Hegseth pushes the ball in Admiral Frank Bradley's court; says stands by 'combat decisions he has made'
summary: Pete Hegseth pushes the ball in Admiral Frank Bradley's court; says stands by 'combat decisions he has made'
content: US War Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Monday that he stands by Admiral Frank Bradley and 'the combat decisions he has made' on September 2. Hegseth said in an X post, "Let’s make one thing crystal clear: Admiral Mitch Bradley is an American hero, a true professional, and has my 100% support. I stand by him and the combat decisions he has made — on the September 2 mission and all others since." "America is fortunate to have such men protecting us. When this @DeptofWar says we have the back of our warriors — we mean it," he added. This comes after Donald Trump said that he would not have ordered the second strike on a vessel from Venezuela allegedly carrying illegal drugs in September and claimed Hegseth had denied giving this order. However, the White House said on Monday that it was indeed Hegseth who had ordered Bradley to conduct said strikes. White House spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt said, "Secretary Hegseth authorized Admiral Bradley to conduct these kinetic strikes. Admiral Bradley worked well within his authority and the law directing the engagement to ensure the boat was destroyed and the threat to the United States of America was eliminated," as per Reuters . Leavitt also said the strikes were conducted to protect US interests, had taken place in international waters, and were in 'self defense' and in accordance with the laws of armed conflict. "This administration has designated these narco terrorists as foreign terrorist organizations," Leavitt said. The Washington Post had earlier reported that the second strike was ordered to take out two individuals who had survived the first strike in order to comply with Hegseth's order that everyone on the boat had to be killed. Hegseth had then lashed out at the claim, saying in an X post , “As usual, the fake news is delivering more fabricated, inflammatory, and derogatory reporting to discredit our incredible warriors fighting to protect the homeland.” Critics on both sides of the fence have been questioning the le

title: Vijay Mallya, Nirav Modi among 15 declared Fugitive Economic Offenders; owe  ₹58,000 crore to PSBs: Govt in Parliament
summary: The Union government has declared 15 individuals, including notorious businessmen Vijay Mallya and Nirav Modi, as Fugitive Economic Offenders, collectively owing  ₹58,000 crore to public sector banks.
content: The Union government has declared as many as 15 individuals, including Vijay Mallya and Nirav Modi, as Fugitive Economic Offenders (FEOs) under the as of 31, October 2025, Union Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Monday informed the Lok Sabha during the ongoing Winter Session of Parliament The information was disseminated in response to an unstarred question raised by Lok Sabha member and Congress Member of Parliament from Dausa, Murari Lal Meena, during the Winter Session of Parliament . Overall, these fugitive economic offenders, as per the Fugitive Economic Offenders Act, 2018 (FEOA), together owe ₹ 58,082 crore to about a dozen public sector banks. This includes a principal amount of ₹ 26,645 as of the date of NPA and ₹ 31,437 as Interest accrued from the date of NPA until 31 October 2025. As of 31 October 2025, ₹ 19,187 crore has been recovered from these offenders, the government said in its response.  Meena had sought from the Finance Minister in Lok Sabha the details about the number of persons declared as fugitive economic offenders to date under the Fugitive Economic Offenders Act, 2018, especially in cases related to large-scale financial frauds committed against public sector banks. "Of the 15 offenders, nine are involved in large-scale financial fraud committed against public sector banks. The list includes several high-profile names, such as Vijay Mallya and Nirav Modi, among others, "Chaudhary said in the response available on the Lok Sabha website. Mallya is accused of a fraud involving over ₹ 9,000 crore borrowed from a consortium of Indian public-sector banks for his now-defunct Kingfisher Airlines . Nirav, along with his uncle Mehul Choksi, is accused of ₹ 13,000-crore scam against Punjab National Bank (PNB) — one of the biggest banking frauds in India’s history. The government brought in the FEO Act in 2018 to deter economic offenders from evading the process of Indian law by remaining outside the jurisdiction of Indian courts. The

title: Centre’s order to pre-install Sanchar Saathi app on all smartphones sparks industry concern
summary: India's government is requiring the Sanchar Saathi app on all smartphones to reduce scams, but major tech firms oppose this due to privacy concerns and potential compliance issues. Critics argue it infringes on user rights and lacks necessary industry consultation.
content: This is a Mint Premium article gifted to you. Subscribe to enjoy similar stories. NEW DELHI : A push by the Centre to curb phone-based scams by mandating a government app on every smartphone in circulation is likely to be opposed by the world’s largest handset makers — including Apple, Google, Samsung — and even industry bodies, according to multiple executives Mint spoke with. The app, Sanchar Saathi, offers cyber security and surveillance features. A non-removable government app may hinder a person’s right to choose, may conflict with India’s newly-minted data-privacy regime, and impose onerous compliance requirements, the executives said on condition of anonymity since their companies were still evaluating the government order. On 28 November, the department of telecommunications (DoT) under the ministry of communications issued a notification to companies that sell mobile phones in India to mandatorily pre-install Sanchar Saathi on all new phones, and use software updates to load them on phones that are already in use. Companies were given 90 days to comply and 120 days to file a compliance report, and asked to ensure that the app cannot be disabled or uninstalled at any point. Mint has seen a copy of the notification. The DoT reinforced its message with a post on social media platform X on Monday evening. To be sure, India has about 750-800 million smartphone users, and just over 150 million smartphones are sold in India every year, as per IDC. Two senior executives at electronics companies, who were privy to the notifications directly, said DoT’s notification was served to reduce the misuse of mobile phones in various scams. “The notification clearly states that Sanchar Saathi must be preinstalled in all mobile phones in order to make it easier for the Centre to track nefarious activities," the first of the two executives said. “Their idea is that if a smartphone’s IMEI (international mobile equipment identity) number is blacklisted on Sanchar Saathi, having t

As technology continues to change the way we learn, live and work, perhaps some of the clearest examples of this transformation can be seen in the workforce. In this blog, we’ll explore this transformation in a little more detail, touching on the roles which didn’t exist in their current form, what’s being done now and look to the future to predict what we think is to come in the next decade or two. In close to two decades, technological needs have transformed the job market, shifted business priorities and shaped skill needs. FutureLearn Category: Career Development , Learning by FutureLearn Category: Career Development , Learning As the world gears up for COP30 and governments race to adapt to climate change, one challenge we face is that we simply don’t have enough people with the skills to make adaptation happen. Here’s how we can tackle that. As the annual global climate conference, the UN Climate Change Conference ( COP30 ) gets underway in Belém, Brazil, governments, global leaders, scientists and researchers are meeting to decide how to drive faster and bolder action to adapt to climate change, and one thing is clear, there’s never been a more crucial time for climate action and adaptation . However there’s a major problem. We’re short on the one thing we need most: people with the skills to make adaptation possible. While demand for green talent is soaring with hiring rates for green talent being 54.6% greater than hiring rates overall (according to LinkedIn’s Global Green Skills Report 2024), demand greatly outweighs the supply. According to the World Economic Forum’s Future of Jobs Report 2025 , ‘despite a global 12% increase in workers acquiring green skills between 2022 and 2023, demand continues to outpace supply, with the number of job postings requiring at least one green skill rising by nearly 22% over the same period’. From supply chain decarbonisation, sustainable building and retrofitting to renewable energy and ecosystem management, recent government climate policies mean that green skills are needed now more than ever to fully lead the green transition and meet the climate goals that have been set. Artificial intelligence (AI) refers to machines simulating human intelligence—learning, reasoning, and making decisions. In 2025, AI is no longer a futuristic concept but a core driver of how we work, live, and innovate. From diagnosing illnesses and generating content to transforming customer service and data analysis, AI is becoming deeply embedded in everyday business operations and our everyday lives. The growth of AI is accelerating rapidly. According to McKinsey , generative AI could contribute between $2.6 trillion and $4.4 trillion annually to the global economy. Meanwhile, Goldman Sachs estimates that up to 300 million jobs worldwide could be affected by AI, with tasks in areas like writing, legal analysis, and design increasingly being automated. While there are growing fears that AI could potentially replace a number of roles, it’s important to note that this technological shift is more about augmentation than replacement—creating space for new roles that complement human skills with AI capabilities. FutureLearn Updated on June 26th, 2025 Category: Career Development , General , Job Market by FutureLearn Updated on June 26th, 2025 Category: Career Development , General , Job Market Want to get ahead with your career? Explore our guide to the fastest-growing jobs, sectors and skills in 2025 and beyond. From the AI boom to the 2024 Budget, employees in 2025 will need to be more strategic than they’ve ever been to get, and stay ahead, in their respective industries. According to a report by Telegraph Money, job vacancies in 2024 have fallen to pre-pandemic levels, by 13.5% to be specific, the lowest since March-May 2021. As the 2024 Budget means higher operating costs for businesses, more employers are cutting back on hiring, but where does this leave an employee in 2025? Keep reading to learn what skills, sectors and jobs you should focus on to put your career at an advantage. Thinking of changing industries? These are some of the fastest-growing industries in 2025. With the growth of generative AI (thanks in part to the launch of ChatGPT) in the workplace in 2024, the increasing need for cybersecurity professionals and general digital literacy, tech continues to be one of 2025’s top sectors according to the World Economic Forum’s (WEF) Future of Jobs 2025 report. An estimated 60% of employers expect that increasing digital access will transform their businesses by 2030. From AI, robotics and automation to information storage and distribution, it’s expected that these trends will have an impact on the sector, with the space for tech professionals continuing to grow in the coming years. title: Why Short-Term Study Abroad Is Gaining Popularity
summary: The post Why Short-Term Study Abroad Is Gaining Popularity appeared first on StudyAbroad.com.
content: Studying abroad has traditionally meant spending a semester or even a year in a foreign country. But today, short-term study abroad programs are rapidly gaining traction among students. With changing academic schedules, tighter budgets, and the need for practical global exposure, more students are turning to shorter, more flexible international experiences. So, why is short-term study abroad popular —and is it the right choice for you? Let’s explore the benefits, opportunities, and growing demand behind this trend. Short-term study abroad typically refers to programs lasting anywhere from one to eight weeks. These may take place during summer, winter break, or spring break, and are often focused on a specific academic subject, cultural immersion, or service-learning project. They provide a condensed, intensive international experience—without the long-term commitment or high costs associated with traditional study abroad. There are several reasons why students are increasingly choosing short-term programs over semester-long stays: College students today often juggle internships, part-time jobs, and packed course loads. Short-term programs allow them to gain global exposure without falling behind academically or missing work opportunities at home. One of the biggest advantages of short-term study abroad programs is cost. They’re often significantly less expensive than semester-long programs, making them more accessible to a wider range of students. In today’s global job market, international experience is highly valued. Short programs focused on specific industries—like business, health care, or environmental science—can help students develop career-ready skills and stand out in competitive job applications. Even a few weeks abroad can offer deep cultural learning, language exposure, and the chance to build a global mindset—something highly desirable for employers and graduate programs alike. There’s a growing body of research suggesting that short-term study abroad

title: Study Abroad Guide: Best Places for Education Majors
summary: The post Study Abroad Guide: Best Places for Education Majors appeared first on StudyAbroad.com.
content: Studying abroad is an incredible opportunity for education majors to gain global perspectives, hands-on teaching experience, and cultural insights that can enrich their future careers. But with so many options available, it’s essential to know the best places to study abroad for education majors that align with your goals and interests. Choosing to study abroad for education majors means more than just attending classes overseas. It’s about immersing yourself in diverse educational systems, understanding different teaching methods, and developing cross-cultural communication skills. These experiences can help future teachers become more adaptable and culturally sensitive educators. Here are some of the best countries to study abroad for education majors that offer strong education programs, practical teaching opportunities, and vibrant cultural experiences: Hankuk University offers excellent programs for education majors, especially those interested in teaching English as a second language. Students benefit from strong language support and opportunities to engage with local schools. The University of Wyoming provides a range of education degrees with hands-on teaching practical experiences. It’s a great option for students seeking diverse classroom settings and innovative teaching methodologies. Known for its focus on research and practical education, the University of Waikato offers education majors a chance to explore indigenous education practices and progressive teaching approaches. Universidad de La Sabana combines strong academic coursework with cultural immersion in one of South America’s most vibrant countries. It’s ideal for education majors looking to gain experience in bilingual and multicultural classrooms. London Metropolitan University is recognized for its inclusive education programs and partnerships with local schools, giving students ample opportunities for classroom practice in a dynamic urban environment. title: Studying Abroad Tips for Introverts: Enjoy Your Experience
summary: The post Studying Abroad Tips for Introverts: Enjoy Your Experience appeared first on StudyAbroad.com.
content: Studying abroad is an exciting adventure—but for introverts, it can also bring a unique set of challenges. While extroverts may thrive on social interactions and spontaneous activities, introverts often need time and space to recharge, making the fast-paced and unfamiliar nature of international travel feel overwhelming. If you’re considering studying abroad as an introvert, or are already preparing for your journey, don’t worry—you can absolutely thrive abroad by embracing your personality and planning ahead. This guide will share helpful tips for introverts studying abroad, so you can enjoy your experience with confidence. When planning to study abroad as an introvert , it’s important to select a program that suits your comfort level. Smaller class sizes, quiet campus environments, and culturally respectful destinations might make your experience more enjoyable. Research universities and cities that align with your lifestyle and pace. Tip: Avoid overly touristy or high-energy cities if you’re easily drained by crowds. Consider places known for their peacefulness or slower lifestyle.  Where you live can greatly impact how you feel abroad. For introverts, having personal space to unwind is essential. If possible, choose a single room in a dorm or a small shared apartment with respectful, like-minded roommates. Tip: Decorate your space with familiar items from home—it can become a comforting retreat after busy days.  Studying abroad as an introvert doesn’t mean isolating yourself—but it does mean respecting your energy limits. It’s okay to say no to events or group outings if you need time to recharge. Tip: Let your new friends or roommates know you value alone time. Clear communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds mutual respect.  Socializing doesn’t have to mean partying or large group events. Look for one-on-one opportunities or small group activities where meaningful connections can develop. Tip: Join interest-based clubs, take art or language class

title: Semester Abroad Packing Guide: Pack Light & Travel Easy
summary: The post Semester Abroad Packing Guide: Pack Light & Travel Easy appeared first on StudyAbroad.com.
content: Master the art of how to pack light for your semester abroad with this comprehensive guide. Whether you’re preparing for a 3 to 6-month adventure, knowing how to pack lightly can make all the difference in your travel experience. This blog offers expert advice on essentials, space-saving hacks, and seasonal considerations to help you travel hassle-free and stress-free. When you’re planning a semester abroad, figuring out what to pack for a semester abroad can feel overwhelming. Unlike a short trip, a semester abroad requires careful thought — you need enough items to last months but want to avoid lugging heavy bags everywhere. Learning how to pack light for a semester abroad helps you strike the perfect balance between preparation and convenience. A minimalist mindset is key when it comes to packing for long-term travel. Use a minimalist packing list to guide you through the essentials. Prioritize versatile clothing that can be mixed and matched according to the season and weather where you’ll be studying abroad. Some things everyone needs when studying abroad for a semester include: To master how to pack lightly, use space-saving hacks like rolling clothes instead of folding, using packing cubes, and wearing your bulkiest items on the plane. Remember, you can always do laundry during your stay, so there’s no need to pack an outfit for every single day. One of the biggest mistakes students make is ignoring the season or weather of their destination. Research the climate and pack accordingly — layering is your best friend! For colder climates, focus on thermal layers and a warm jacket. For warmer destinations, light fabrics and sun protection are essential. title: Overcoming Language Anxiety While Studying Abroad
summary: The post Overcoming Language Anxiety While Studying Abroad appeared first on StudyAbroad.com.
content: Studying abroad is an exciting adventure, but it often comes with a challenge that many students face: foreign language anxiety. Whether you’re taking classes, making friends, or navigating daily life, this fear can make it difficult to fully enjoy your experience. In this blog, we’ll explore what foreign language anxiety is and share effective strategies for overcoming foreign language anxiety while studying abroad. Before diving into solutions, it’s important to understand what is foreign language anxiety is. It’s a specific type of nervousness or fear that arises when using a new language in social or academic settings. This anxiety can cause self-doubt, hesitation, and sometimes even physical symptoms like sweating or rapid heartbeat. Many students feel pressure to speak perfectly, which increases stress and makes communication even harder. If you’re wondering how to overcome language anxiety, you’re not alone. Here are some proven tips that can help: The more you practice, the more confident you’ll feel. Remember, mistakes are part of learning. Instead of fearing errors, see them as opportunities to improve. Don’t expect perfection overnight. Set small, achievable goals for each day, such as learning five new words or starting a conversation with a classmate. Join language clubs, use apps, or find study groups. Having a community where you can practice without judgment makes a huge difference. Anticipate common phrases or questions you’ll encounter while studying in a foreign language . Preparing ahead reduces anxiety when those moments happen. 5. Practice Mindfulness and Relaxation Techniques like deep breathing or meditation can help manage physical symptoms of anxiety before and during conversations. Aside from managing anxiety, effective study habits can boost your overall success. title: Master Culinary Arts Abroad for Global Success
summary: The post Master Culinary Arts Abroad for Global Success appeared first on StudyAbroad.com.
content: If you’re passionate about food and dream of becoming a world-class chef, you may be wondering: why study culinary arts abroad instead of locally? The answer is simple—studying culinary arts abroad gives you access to diverse cuisines, hands-on training with international chefs, and a rich cultural experience that shapes your culinary perspective. In today’s globalized kitchen, having international experience isn’t just impressive—it can significantly benefit your culinary career. Here’s why pursuing a culinary arts study abroad program is one of the smartest moves for aspiring chefs. One of the biggest benefits of culinary art schools abroad is the chance to study regional dishes right where they originated. Want to master French pastries, Thai street food, or Italian pasta? There’s no better place to learn than in France, Thailand, or Italy. Instead of reading about techniques or watching online tutorials, you’re getting first-hand training in the country’s food culture. That level of authenticity can’t be replicated in a classroom back home. When you study culinary arts abroad , you’re exposed to a variety of ingredients, preparation styles, and cultural traditions. This diverse knowledge not only enhances your creativity in the kitchen but also prepares you for a global culinary career. Your palate expands, your understanding of food deepens, and you gain the ability to blend techniques and flavors across borders. This is one of the best ways to develop a truly international approach to cooking. Employers in the culinary industry value candidates with international training. Why? Because it shows adaptability, independence, and a broader understanding of food and hospitality. Whether you want to work in five-star restaurants, open your own fusion restaurant, or become a culinary educator, international experience can set you apart. Simply put, how international experience can benefit your career is by opening doors that domestic education often can’t. If you’re

title: 10 Best Countries for Studying Health Abroad
summary: The post 10 Best Countries for Studying Health Abroad appeared first on StudyAbroad.com.
content: Studying healthcare abroad is one of the best ways to gain a global perspective, practical experience, and exposure to different medical systems. Choosing the best countries for health study abroad programs can enhance both your education and future career in healthcare. Here are the 10 best countries to study abroad for healthcare, selected for their academic quality, cultural experiences, and healthcare learning opportunities. The USA remains a top choice for international students pursuing healthcare and medical degrees. With world-renowned institutions, cutting-edge research, and diverse clinical settings, it’s one of the best countries for health study abroad programs — especially for students looking to study medicine, nursing, or public health. Home to prestigious universities like King’s College London and University College London, England offers world-class healthcare education. Students benefit from the UK’s National Health Service (NHS), which provides an excellent framework for clinical placements and learning about public health systems. Scotland combines top academic institutions with a supportive learning environment. Known for its medical schools in Edinburgh and Glasgow, it’s a best place for health students to study abroad who want an innovative, student-friendly setting. Emerging as a cost-effective destination, Georgia offers internationally recognized medical programs taught in English. Students looking to study healthcare abroad at an affordable rate without compromising quality often choose Georgia. The Czech Republic is home to several universities with strong medical faculties and international health programs. With affordable tuition, excellent healthcare infrastructure, and a central European location, it’s a rising star for studying health abroad. Hungary has built a solid reputation for offering English-taught medical programs. Cities like Budapest and Szeged attract international students for their practical training, affordable costs,

title: How Studying Abroad Builds Key Life Skills
summary: The post How Studying Abroad Builds Key Life Skills appeared first on StudyAbroad.com.
content: Studying abroad is more than just an academic experience—it’s a powerful journey of personal growth. Whether you’re heading to Europe, Asia, or anywhere in between, living and learning in a new culture offers you the chance to build skills that last a lifetime. So, what skills do you gain from studying abroad ? Let’s explore the most valuable skills you can expect to develop—and why they matter long after your trip ends.  One of the most important skills you gain from studying abroad is the ability to adapt to new environments. From navigating unfamiliar cities to handling cultural differences, you learn to think on your feet and become more self-reliant. This kind of independence prepares you to handle future challenges in both personal and professional settings. What skills does studying abroad give you that truly stand out in the workplace? Cross-cultural communication is high on the list. When you study abroad, you interact with people from different backgrounds and learn to communicate across language barriers and cultural norms. This skill is essential in our increasingly globalized world and can give you a serious advantage in international careers. Being in a new country often means facing unexpected situations. Whether it’s figuring out public transport or resolving a housing issue, you’ll need to think critically and solve problems on the spot. These are exactly the kind of soft skills employers value—making them a crucial part of the list of skills from study abroad experiences. The process of stepping outside your comfort zone builds confidence. Overcoming homesickness, managing your own finances, or succeeding in a foreign classroom can all make you more resilient and self-assured. So if you’re wondering what skills you can get from study abroad, don’t overlook the personal growth that fuels both academic and career success. Naturally, studying abroad improves language skills —especially if you’re living in a country where a different language is spoken

title: What Parents Should Know Before Study Abroad
summary: The post What Parents Should Know Before Study Abroad appeared first on StudyAbroad.com.
content: Sending your child to study abroad is one of the most rewarding experiences for any parent — but it also comes with plenty of questions and concerns. Understanding what parents need to know about studying abroad can make the process smoother and less stressful. From travel safety and budgeting to emotional support, this guide will help parents feel confident and prepared as their children embark on an international education journey. Before your child boards the plane, make sure you understand the program details: Doing this research helps parents of study abroad students feel confident and involved in their child’s journey. To better understand destination options, explore Why Study Abroad in Asia? , which highlights the benefits of this growing region for students. Safety is one of the top concerns for parents of students studying abroad. Make sure your child: For official updates, check the U.S. Department of State Travel Advisories before they depart, and review country-specific safety information. It’s also important to discuss vaccinations, medication, and general wellness before they go. Parents can find helpful information on the CDC Travelers’ Health website for country-specific guidelines. Studying abroad can come with hidden expenses. Discuss: If you’re wondering about the return on investment, read Is Studying Abroad Worth It? Reasons to Study Overseas to see how these experiences can benefit your child’s future career and growth. Knowing how and when you’ll stay in touch can ease anxiety for both parent and student. Will you video chat weekly or message daily? Having a clear plan helps you stay connected without being intrusive.
